greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the number of distinct n-th powers of functions {1, 2} -> {1, 2}.
link: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0, 1).
example: a(4) = 3: the four functions {1, 2} -> {1, 2} are f(x) = 1, g(x) = 2, h(x) = x and j(x) = 3 - x. f^4(x) = f(f(f(f(x)))) = 1; so f^4 = f. Similarly, g^4 = g, h^4 = h and j^4 = h, so there are 3 distinct 4th powers.
results.author: _David Wasserman_, Feb 21 2005
